page.title: 16LONGFORGAN - BERRY PICKING -
page.content: I stumbled out of bed at 6.30 a.m. on a morning in the middle of June and got ready for work. I set off at 6.50 a.m. for the farm and got a luggie (a small bucket tied with string to the waist) and a large black bucket. I got a dreel (a row of strawberries) and started to pick. Soon the berry bus arrived with lots of pickers from Dundee. My hands were quickly covered with berry juice. I emptied the full luggie into the black bucket until it was full and took it to be weighed-in and I got Â£1.30. We got paid 5p a pound. It's hard work but worth it. At 12.30 p.m. I sat on my bucket and had lunch.Then I picked on till 4.30 p.m. At the end of the day everybody looks awful with berry juice and squashed strawberries on them, which we have thrown at each other. It was worth it as I made Â£6.15 for my days work.
